headline: Twice Baked Potato Casserole With Bacon
description: Twice-baked potato casserole is a simple and delicious way to use all the ingredients for twice-baked potatoes in a cheesy, creamy, comforting dish.

video.description: Potatoes, bacon, cheese...need we say more?
video.name: Twice Baked Potato Casserole with Bacon

name: Twice Baked Potato Casserole With Bacon

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch casserole dish.
Use a toothpick to poke a few holes into each potato.
Bake potatoes in the preheated oven until fully cooked, about 1 hour. Cool for about 15 minutes.
Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on a paper towel-lined plate; crumble and set aside.
Cut a thin slice from one side of each baked potato; carefully scoop out flesh and transfer to a large bowl. Discard skins.
Mix 1/2 of the Cheddar cheese, sour cream, milk, butter, chives, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper into potatoes until well combined.
Spread potato mixture into the prepared casserole dish; top with remaining Cheddar cheese and crumbled bacon.
Bake in the preheated oven until just bubbling, 10 to 15 minutes. Cool for at least 5 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: Made this as a different potato casserole this year and what a hit!!! everyone mentioned how absolutely good it was, or that it was their favorite out of all the food. I think baking the potatoes gives them a fuller/richer flavor, than boiling potatoes or using the hash browns like I have done in the past. This is definitely added to the "must have for Christmas" meal list ( I doubled the recipe)

This is amazing. My family went crazy for it. I added onion powder and used chip dip instead of sour creme...I had to use 6 baked potatoes because 2 isn't enough for a 9x13 pan. In our house we love leftovers !
I love the baked potatoe casserole it has a lot of flavor

These were very good potatoes. I did do a few shortcuts because I like things to be easy. I cooked the potatoes in the microwave and used bacon bits instead of frying the bacon. Easy and delicious, I made the dish ahead of time and then baked them at dinner time like suggested in the tips. Would definitely make again.
I made mine with smother fried potatoes onions and sausage diced then followed directions it’s amazing

Very good - but must agree w/ the majority of the comments - 2 large potatoes will NOT fill a 9x13 pan. I used 4 large, kept all the other ingredients the same - but added a tad bit more mild. Put in 9x9 pan and it was perfect for the four of us.
This was really very good, made no changes and the family loved it!

Excellent recipe. 
Everyone loved it.
LUVD IT!!!!!!
Everyone loved this. Was so easy to make. It call for 2 potatoes, I got the biggest ones I could find and they were perfect. Will be making this again for sure.

Outstanding! One of the best potato casseroles I've made in years- and easy. To save yourself even more time, you can use pre-cooked bacon and microwave it until it is very crunchy (also gets rid of some of the fat). The combination of flavors was great and can be adjusted to your preferences as far as actual baked potatoes. I mixed fresh chives in mine as opposed to the dry, which I didn't have. The chives came out still retaining some crunch and the taste was wonderful. I really don't understand why this isn't a SIX star recipe!
This was delicious, and a hit with everyone.
Delicious and easy! Everyone loved it!
This is an awesome recipe, and great with sour cream on side.

No photo we finished it off ! But I used 3 large baking potatoes , an 8x8 glass pan . Used Half and Half instead of milk . Only sprinkled shredded cheese on top with the bacon pieces . Cooked/baked for 30 minutes . Made ahead the day before. It was fantastic. Will make again

Delicious! I agree with other reviewers, about needing more than 2 potatoes. Luckily for me, I had two massive potatoes I used for this. I used the microwave to cook them (to save time). Other than that, made the recipe exactly as directed. The best part was that all the ingredients are easily found around the house. This made for an easy and scrumptious side dish for dinner!
My son put most of this together the day before it was needed. I finished up with cooking the bacon and adding cheese on top to bake it. We liked the fact that it was made ahead.
Followed the recipe, very good and easy to make. We fried up the left overs for breakfast!

The ingredients all go very well together, however, I feel there is too much bacon and cheese. I make a similar recipe using leftover mashed potatoes. When I make mashed potatoes for another meal, I double the recipe and save half for "loaded baked potatoe casserole". I add a little extra salt and pepper, a heaping tbsp of greek yogurt (sour cream if that's what you have on hand) and place in an 8×8 baking dish, cover with 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese, top with 3 slices of chopped bacon and chives or green part of scallions. I cover with foil and place in a 350 oven until cheese is melted. I then uncover and bake for 5 minutes. This recipe is always a hit and can be put together rather quickly since I'm using leftover potatoes. Even quicker if you have cooked bacon in the fridge as I always have
I made this recipe for a co.pany bbq & everyone loved it
this was so good. my kids are picky and one doesn't like cheese but they love the combination.
Decent recipe, I cant really rate this truthfully because I used boxed mashed potatoes because I was in a rush but still tasted great!
No way 2 potatoes would make a meal. Used 4 and everything else the same. This was a yummy tutor casserole dish.
My family and I loved it! We made this for Easter dinner. I used two pounds of boiled red potatoes and garlic herb butter. It was amazing!
Very good .. will proably cut back on the cheeses just a smidge next time, only because we like stiffer mashed potatoes

Only had bacon bits on hand so decide to sprinkle them on top for the crunch affect - it did the trick. This recipe was super easy & was so yummy! Planning to make it a holiday menu regular . Thanks for sharing the recipe.
Cheers-
I made this dish and it was a hit. The bacon was a great addition. Will most definitely be making this casserole regularly.
Use at least 5 large russet potatoes and increase sour cream to desired consistency. This was really good!
I made it and it is fantastic, but the measurement are way off. I used 8 potatoes and adjusted the rest of the ingredients to my taste. I also boiled the potatoes. HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT.
Dude! Just smash the taters with the skin on!! AND l used combo milk/plain greek yogurt in place of the sour cream .Very tasty, indeed!

IF YOU'RE MAKING THIS FOR A FUNCTION DOUBLE THE RECIPE!!!!
Great tasting side, everyone LOVED it.
The problem was, it didn't come close to filling my 9x13 pan. I made this for a family dinner and had to rush like a crazy person to double the recipe in order to have an actually full casserole dish.
And yes, I followed the instructions to a T.
The amount was perfect for a 9x9 square pan.

This was a great casserole, and it got rave reviews from the fam! I did make a few changes, I used more bacon (6 slices I think), halved the sour cream, and added cheese on top before it went in the oven. This is a keeper!!
How can you not love this dish. So heart healthy, ha-ha. It's got all the bad stuff you're not supposed to eat, but it tastes like heaven. :D

The concept is great, but I'm not sure why it's written for only 2 potatoes and 9x13 pan. It would be VERY shallow. I put it in a 9x13 and it hardly covered the bottom. I used 4 potatoes and put it in an 9x9 dish and it worked great! I substituted the sour cream with Greek yogurt and it also turned out well! Either way, I'm happy this was posted, but some things needed changed.
No changes and will make many times over

We've made this at least five times for dinners as our go-to mashed potato dish. Depending on the size of the potatoes, I might add a little extra milk for some extra creaminess. We also place half of the bacon in the dish and add some garlic powder for added flavor. We've always gotten rave reviews on it.
This was a HIT for our Thanksgiving dinner. WIll definitely be making this again!
Amazing. Enough said. I had absolutely zero leftovers and my kids ended up arguing about who got the final serving! Love this recipe!
I made this for a party and the people who ate it raved about it and went on and on about how delicious it was! Winner Winner!
Everyone loved. From 21 year old son to 90 year old parents.

This recipe tastes great. Anyway, if you add a dose of common sense and use 2 or 3 *more* potatoes OR less cheese and bacon, it works out fine. (Keeping other ingredients like sour cream, milk, butter, spices, as listed.) This is also an awesome way to use up leftover mashed potatoes! Substitute the baking potatoes for about 3-4 cups of mashed.
I made this, divided some of it into single-service containers, and froze them for my mom. It reheats very well, and we all love it!
Might wanna ease up on the sour cream, the casserole was a bit runny but still very delicious
Love this!

I'm not one to overcomplicate or change recipes . However , 2 potatoes for a 9x13 is not enough . Also to save time I microwave my potatoes (always) . anyway , they were delicious. Even my picky son loved them . Will definitely make again , several times .

I was looking for a twice baked potatoe recipe that was quick and easy to make for an impromptu get together. So I googled and this one stood out so I whipped it up. Not only is it easy, it's delicious!!! It was a hit!! Highly recommend this recipe.
this is awesome...make extra
Very easy and quick
Throw away the skins? I don't think so. They're the best, most nutritious part of the potato
I quadrupled this recipe and took it to our family Mother's Day celebration. It was a great hit. Everyone wants the recipe.
I made it the day before and it tasted great after baking it the next day. Also, I used 5lbs of potatoes with the measurements of ingredients listed.
Made it for Easter. It was awesome! Actually, made it without the chives. Everyone couldn’t stop eating it.
This is really good. I did have to do some guessing on how many potatoes to use, wish people would put in how many pounds to use instead of a number.

My first review and this was definitely worth it. Hubby loves onion and real garlic so only change I made was to saute a little chopped onion and about half a teaspoon in the butter as it melted then added them to the potatoes. Can't imagine usint a 9 x 13 pan. I used my largest pyrex casserole from my 24 piece set and had plenty of room. Baked for about 15 minutes while I grilled the ham steak and we had a really great Easter meal. For a lot less than a restaurant. Thanks for such a great recipe. We'll use it often.

Made mashed potatoes instead of baking the potatoes. 2 baking potatoes are definitely NOT enough for a 9x13 casserole. Takes about 2-1/2 pounds of medium size potatoes. Used sharp cheddar for extra flavor.
I used cream, and used the mixer to mash the potatoes. The potatoes got sticky, so I added some milk. Turned out really good..
I cut back on the cheese and glad I did because this was a little greasy but the flavor was fantastic. Will definitely make again.
Very good
No changes to recipe and it was great!
It was a good casserole

Turned out pretty well. I used 4 medium-large russet potatoes with all other ingredient quantities the same, and it turned out fine. I also added a can of diced mild green chilis and some sliced jalapenos on the top layer of cheese, and both of those additions worked well. I think it's better if you mash up the potatoes pretty thoroughly, rather than leaving them chunky. I will make it again.

These were the first mashed potatoes I've ever made and my guests said they were the best mashed potatoes they'd ever had! I put all ingredients (except cheese) in the mixer and it was the perfect consistency and perfect flavor.
Super easy to make, and very pleased with the flavor.
My family loved
Turned out really well. I did add some hamburger meat and mixed in with potatoes (mmm cow) to make it more of a main dish. Turned out delicious.
I'm not sure I'd turn fresh bakers into a casserole, but it was a great way to use up leftover mashed potatoes!

Big hit today at a family brunch! 2 potatoes is simply not enough, I used 5 potatoes and doubled everything and still used a 9x13 pan with no issues size wise. Creamy double baked goodness. I’ve been told I need to make it again for Christmas.

Made this at my son's request , for Thanksgiving. Everyone loved this dish. I think the size of the pan is off. I doubled the recipe and used a 1.5 quart casserole dish and could have doubled again with room to spare. This was a huge hit and I will be making again, without doubt.
This is nice for 2 people. It will not feed your large Thanksgiving group.

I make this all the time, but never used a recipe, just the same ingredients...with minor changes..1/2 and 1/2 instead of milk, fresh chives, REAL bacon (another reviewer said she used bacon bits) I would never go through all the work without using at least 6-8 big potatoes! It is just as good when warmed and eaten the next few days. An old time recipe similar to my moms and grandmas! Easy and comforting!
I've never made a twice baked potato before. I added chopped mushrooms and steamed broccoli. Turned out really good!
So good! Doubled recipe. Used season salt instead of regular salt like someone suggested. Great flavor!
Used red potatoes, left the skins on. Cut the raw bacon into pieces & sauteed it with diced onions. SO GOOD. Will make again when I'm allowed to...Lol.

This was delicious and the perfect accompaniment to Chef John's Sweet Mustard Chicken Thighs. I added dried shallots to this as well, and rubbed the baking dish with the tiniest amount of bacon grease. The casserole lifted out easily and had a nice golden brown bottom and edges.
I made this for my Grandchildren. They were a little hesitant, but ate it up. I made it in advance, and put it in the oven when they were ready for Dinner. They let me know that it’s a winner.
I did increase the amount of potatoes and the other ingredients. It baked up like a potato puff ! Delicious!,

Delicious!! Made two large batches using the exact recipe, no tweaks except I left the red potato skins on, for a family picnic and it was gone practically in minutes. Family loved it! Can't wait till the Holidays to make this again. This time I'll make double.
Fixed this last night and it was great. I think next time I will use a slightly smaller disk so it will be thicker plus add some onion to the mix.
Made this for a family get together and it quickly disappeared! Delicious!
This turned out just as expected. I should have put a little more salt/pepper but otherwise it turned out great and was a hit at a bbq.
I liked it a lot. I added jalapenos and scallions and it was even better!

It was delicious! My granddaughter who is a picky eater even liked it! I passed this recipe on to my daughter and they enjoyed it also.
I used smoked sausage and chives as well
I added green onions and I will make it again!
add green onion on top

I have made this several time and have made some changes which have proved to be a hit. First, I make sautéed caramelized onions and layer them in the bottom of the 9"x13" casserole dish. I also double the bacon and mix half of the bacon into the potato mixture (the other half I put on top of the cheese top as the recipe calls for. Last change is that I also mix green onions into the potato mix. The sautéed onions on the bottom of the dish really adds to the flavor of this great dish. I get regular requests to make this for family gatherings and most people have two helpings.

Made this as my contribution to a 14 person family dinner for Easter. I used a 5lb bag of russets and scaled the other ingredients up though not in equal proportion as with cheese, bacon and whole milk it's already fat and calorie heavy. Also used additional seasoning as others suggested. Russets didn't whip smoothly no matter what I did. For all the work and cost of cheese and bacon, this was just a potato dish. I have other potato recipes that are more impressive and take less work. The only highlight is I did flash freeze the potato skins for use another day and I'm looking forward to fixing those later.
blah....

I doubled or tripled some of the ingredients to have a full pan for a Thanksgiving side dish, because the recipe seems more like an appetizer. Can't really say how much of each ingredient I used, but everyone loved it! It was delicious!

The twice baked potato casserole came out perfectly. I suggest using only 1/2 the bacon. I also suggest that you use the bacon grease left over from cooking the bacon and the skin of the potato and make potato chips out of it. I would highly suggest making it and I would make it again.

Delicious! I added more garlic powder to mine, just cause I am a fan of garlic, but I'm sure it would have been delicious with the original amount, too. I mean, cheese + potatoes + sour cream... How can you go wrong?
It was delicious! i did change the ingredients quantity to my own liking. Used spring onions instead of chives, only added bacon after baking (to control the flavor) together with dried parsley
It was fabulas did not change anything and it disappeared! Surely will make again!
This was so delicious
Family loved it for Christmas dinner. I used 2-3 lbs of potatoes and it worked out great. Definitely a keeper especially with picky kids.
This was so good! My family and I enjoyed it!

This is a good recipe, but I did change a few things. I doubled the quantity of potatoes and everything else, and I made them by baking them in the oven, then mashing them. 
Came out great.
yummy! added a bit of Lawry's seasoning salt. delicious.
I thought it was good but lacking in flavor outside of the bacon. Spice it up and this is a winner and good for a crowd.

No way 2 potatoes would fill a 9x13” dish! I used 6 large potatoes & used rest of ingredients as called for. Someone must have made a mistake on potato amount?!? Anyway ...it was sooo good! Great for potlucks. Oh, I cut back on time as it was limited & microwaved the potatoes. I usually bake them tho,..cuz I LUV the crispy skins! Yum!

item.name: Twice Baked Potato Casserole With Bacon
